page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The area includes the villages of { {St.Day}and{Chacewater}and many hamlets.All have strong connections with the 19th Century mining boom.The block contains what was once the richest square mile{in the world, {because of its copper mines.}This recent past influences the region today and is reflected in many place names beginning with{"wheal"}which in the Cornish Language means{"mine". Many acres of mine waste are now covered with gorse and heath.Also there are many {mine shafts,}now been capped .Using modern methods mine waste is being reprocessed and more tin extracted. Because of this some {conservation and restoration}has taken place.Many fields in the area have been recovered from mine operations .About 60% of the block is pasture.
